pr_title: Update error and exception model design for Text Analytics

timeline.message: throw exception if success property accessed
Add custom exception for single input 200 ok error
throw exception if success property accessed

timeline.bodyText: I might be missing something, but what happens if no innerError is returned? Will the top level error code/message/target be used?
timeline.author: kristapratico

replies.bodyText: It currently doesn't do that, but I think it should. Will update!
replies.author: samvaity

timeline.bodyText: Would it make sense to return the document id/error message in the exception message here?
timeline.author: kristapratico

timeline.bodyText: Amqp?
timeline.author: kristapratico

timeline.bodyText: Passing in an empty string gives an invalid country hint error?
timeline.author: kristapratico

timeline.bodyText: What's the different between toTextAnalyticsException() and toTextAnalyticsError()? When is error used and when is exception used?
timeline.author: srnagar

replies.bodyText:
Every TextAnalyticsError returned the service is converted to the sdk equivalent TextAnalyticsError i.e uses toTextAnalyticsError().
And in cases of methods taking in a single input if such error is encountered, it is converted to toTextAnalyticsException().
replies.author: samvaity

timeline.bodyText: This piece of code is repeated in each of the error mappers. Avoid duplication and extract this out to a common method.
timeline.author: srnagar

timeline.bodyText:
This method always throws an exception, however, it's not clear from this code that the method ends here. I was assuming that it would still continue to return SimpleResponse before looking at toTextAnalyticsException() method.
Instead, return the exception from toTextAnalyticsException() and change this to throw toTextAnalyticsException().
timeline.author: srnagar

timeline.bodyText: Use Locale.ROOT instead of Locale.US

timeline.author: srnagar

replies.bodyText: Error here is guaranteed to have code and message.

timeline.bodyText: Generate the servialVersionUID instead of setting it to 1L

timeline.message: add tests for success property access exception

timeline.bodyText: Was this a manual change or a regeneration change? If the former this will be overwritten next time the implementation layer is regenerated.
timeline.author: alzimmermsft

replies.bodyText: I think the refactor for name change made this change, will revert this.
replies.author: samvaity

timeline.bodyText: Should this accept a ClientLogger? Won't everything calling into this use the DocumentResult.class logger?
timeline.author: alzimmermsft

timeline.bodyText: Should this be turned back into a TextAnalyticsErrorCode? Generally don't want to have to much loose string matching on error codes.
timeline.author: alzimmermsft

timeline.bodyText: Is it possible to have a target without an error code a vice-versa? This seems like it could be cleaned up to check that both aren't 'null' at once and do a full string formatting.
timeline.author: alzimmermsft

replies.bodyText: It should always have error code but target can be null. Can clean it that way.
replies.author: samvaity

timeline.bodyText: baseMessage could be returned here instead of retrieving it from the super class again.
timeline.author: alzimmermsft

timeline.bodyText: Let's make 'ErrorCodeValue` a constant
timeline.author: alzimmermsft

replies.bodyText: Actually, why isn't this in the format string?

timeline.author: alzimmermsft

replies.bodyText: Actually, why isn't this in the format string?

timeline.bodyText: Could a StringBuilder be used instead of using two String.format calls?
timeline.author: alzimmermsft

timeline.bodyText: Why do the other String.format changes use Locale.ROOT where this does not?
timeline.author: alzimmermsft

timeline.bodyText: Since this is package private it won't be inherited by the subclasses, will this require any additional parameters to be passed?
timeline.author: alzimmermsft

replies.bodyText: Given that it is an exception to be raised for accessing success attributes on output models, this method would always be accessed in the model classes which exist in the same packages.
replies.author: samvaity

timeline.bodyText:
Will this exception always be for 200 only?  A different exception is thrown for 4xx/5xx codes?
It's possible TA service could add another top-level error.  Does this exception type leave room to grow if they do?
Right now they have just these top-level errors:
      "enum": [
        "invalidRequest", // 400
        "invalidArgument", // 200
        "internalServerError", // 500
        "serviceUnavailable"  // 500
      ],

What exception type would we throw if they added another for 200?  Would you inherit from TextAnalyticsException or differentiate it another way?
timeline.author: annelo-msft

replies.bodyText:
Will this exception always be for 200 only? A different exception is thrown for 4xx/5xx codes?

Yes, we have HttpResponseException to deal with the unsuccessful response received with HTTP status code (e.g. 3XX, 4XX, 5XX) from the service request.

What exception type would we throw if they added another for 200?

For another 200 added from the service side, we can update the getMessage() method to handle it accordingly. TextAnalyticsException can still be reused in those cases.
Also, on this, I am considering removing Status code from the exception message as it would be repetitive info with the response.
replies.author: samvaity

timeline.bodyText: We have error code as a string in .NET rather than having an enum for it.  Not sure what the philosophy is on this on the Java side, but in .NET if we did expose this as an enum, we would want a service-specific name for it to avoid type name clashes down the line.  This is a candidate for a common library, but we're still operating under the assumption that we won't get there for TextAnalytics (this could change).
timeline.author: annelo-msft

replies.bodyText:
Correct, this was reverted as it was a code generated file and should not have been changed.
The enum exposed to the users is named TextAnalyticsErrorCode.
replies.author: samvaity

replies.bodyText: Ah, ok.  I must have read the code incorrectly.
replies.author: annelo-msft

replies.bodyText: Do you have the same issue that we have in .NET where it's a breaking change to add values to an enum?
replies.author: annelo-msft

replies.bodyText: No, it wouldn't since in Java we use ExpandableStringEnum that allows this enum to accept any future values that service team could add.
replies.author: samvaity

replies.bodyText:
ExpandableStringEnum that allows this enum to accept any future values that service team could add.

Cool :)
replies.author: maririos

timeline.message: Remove status code from single error response exception

timeline.bodyText: ClientLogger doesn't have to be passed around. Use a ClientLogger that is created with the name of this class.
timeline.author: srnagar
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -88,20 +104,40 @@ static TextDocumentBatchStatistics toBatchStatistics(RequestStatistics statistic
     }
 
     /**
-     * Helper method to set error details on {@link TextAnalyticsError}.
+     * Convert the incoming input {@link com.azure.ai.textanalytics.models.TextAnalyticsError}
+     * to a {@link TextAnalyticsException}.
+     *
+     * @param error the {@link com.azure.ai.textanalytics.models.TextAnalyticsError}.
+     * @return the {@link TextAnalyticsException} to be thrown.
+     */
+    static TextAnalyticsException toTextAnalyticsException(com.azure.ai.textanalytics.models.TextAnalyticsError error) {
+        return new TextAnalyticsException(error.getMessage(),
+            error.getCode().toString(),
+            error.getTarget());
+    }
+
+    /**
+     * Convert the service returned model response {@link DocumentResultCollection} to a {@link SimpleResponse}.
+     * If the response returned with an error, a {@link TextAnalyticsException} is thrown.
+     *
+     * @param response the {@link com.azure.ai.textanalytics.models.TextAnalyticsError}.
+     * @param logger the {@link ClientLogger} used to log any exception.
+     *
+     * @return the {@link SimpleResponse}.
      *
-     * @param details about specific errors that led to this reported error.
-     * @return the {@link TextAnalyticsError} returned by the SDK.
+     * @throws com.azure.ai.textanalytics.models.TextAnalyticsException if the response returned with
+     * an {@link com.azure.ai.textanalytics.models.TextAnalyticsError error}.
      */
-    private static List<com.azure.ai.textanalytics.models.TextAnalyticsError> setErrors(
-        List<TextAnalyticsError> details) {
-        List<com.azure.ai.textanalytics.models.TextAnalyticsError> detailsList = new ArrayList<>();
-        for (TextAnalyticsError error : details) {
-            detailsList.add(new com.azure.ai.textanalytics.models.TextAnalyticsError(
-                ErrorCodeValue.fromString(error.getCode().toString()),
-                error.getMessage(),
-                error.getTarget(), error.getDetails() == null ? null : setErrors(error.getDetails())));
+    static <T extends DocumentResult> Response<T> processSingleResponseErrorResult(
+        Response<DocumentResultCollection<T>> response, ClientLogger logger) {
